results.title: Dick Tracy. Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Alan James and Republic Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: This movie serial sees for the first time on screen Dick Tracy (Ralph Byrd) and his G-men battling against urban evil. This time it’s the club-footed mastermind know as The Lame One who plots a war on the G-men. Using his stratospheric aircraft he terrorises the city with his high-frequency sound wave weapon. At the same time, The Spider Gang kidnap Tracy’s brother, Gordon. Part two contains episodes eight to thirteen.

results.title: Dick Smith: make-up artist
results.creator_credit: David E. Smith and Texture Films
results.brief_description: Dick Smith talks about his work as a make up artist for the motion picture industry. He shows the aging techniques he used on Dustin Hoffman in ‘Little Big Man’ and Marlon Brando in ‘The Godfather’. Narrated by David Luster.

results.title: Dick Sharp and the case of the missing white-out
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
Private eye Dick Sharp gets embroiled in mystery, corruption, big business and double crossing while he endeavours to find the criminal responsible for stealing all the white-out in the city. A 1940’s noir style mystery thriller.

results.title: Dick Muffin special agent
results.creator_credit: Jan Bussell, Parthian Production and Peak Films
results.brief_description: Muffin with his thinking cap. Muffin as sleuth wearing black hat and moustache. A dog comes in and complains that he has lost a bone. Song about the “Old Dry Bone”. Muffin in disguise as a girl with pigtails. Penguin comes and he has lost his stopwatch. Muffin the detective, disguised as a Chinese.

results.title: Dick Hickey: blacksmith
results.creator_credit: Lorne Batchelor, Dave Bennett and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The blacksmith shop as a place for home-spun philosophy, where the village old-timers gather around the smithy stove to listen as the blacksmith, personified by Dick Hickey, goes about his work and shares his reflections about old times and the blacksmith’s craft.

results.title: Dick Deadeye or duty done
results.creator_credit: Bill Melendez, Steven Cuitlahuac Melendez and Bill Melendez Productions
results.brief_description: This animated jaunty rollick of music, comedy and quirky little characters is based on the orginal works of Gilbert and Sullivan (including some new lyrics by Robin Miller) and features the voices of Victor Spinetti, Peter Reeves, George A. Cooper, Miriam Karlin, John Newton.

results.title: Dick
results.creator_credit: Andrew Fleming, Gale Anne Hurd, Pacific Western and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Betsy and Arlene are typical American girls growing up in the seventies - they love platform shoes, television and talking about David Cassidy. One night the two accidentally witness the Watergate break in and the next day whilst visiting the Whitehouse, President Richard Nixon (‘call me Dick’) decides to hire the girls as dog walkers in order to keep a close eye on them. The pair idolise their leader until they witness a slew of dubious incidents that lead them to believe that Dick may not be an honest man. Leaking information to Carl Bernstein and Bob Woodward of the Washington Post, these two legendary news hounds are depicted as vainglorious, petty and just a little dim. As the story hots up Betsy and Arlene suspect they are being trailed and bugged by Dick’s cronies. Could these two spunky friends possibly be the infamous deepthroat? “Dick” is a comedy that lovingly sends up the frivolously upbeat world of the female teen, and is backed by a funky 70s soundtrack. The film succeeds as a satire of American politics and the press whilst reliving a particularly lurid period in fashion that revelled in a gaudy aesthetic. Kirsten Dunst and Michelle Williams are superbly funny in the lead roles.

results.title: Diavolezza
results.creator_credit: Walther Rufer, British Petroleum and Condor-Films
results.brief_description: A trip aboard the Diavolezza cable railway, Switzerland. Scenes include the views from the railway which are just short of breathtaking.

results.title: Diastrophism: what moves mountains, what shapes the seas?
results.creator_credit: Richard Slote, Richard Lukin and Universal Education and Visual Arts
results.brief_description: Part of the “Science and the earth” series, this film provides an explanation of what scientists know about diastrophism, the forces which shape the earth’s surface. While earthquakes and volcanoes provide some information, much more is still required. Using animated maps and drawings the effects of earthquakes on the crust, mantle and core are shown. Such theories as whether the earth’s crust is floating on a sea of molten rock, whether the surface is shrinking or expanding in area, the origin of the continents and whether currents within the earth cause folding, are explored.
